title: Ticket #1734: Java universe breaks if one tries to configure JAVA_MAXHEAP_ARGUMENT
description: Java universe is broken if one tries to set JAVA_MAXHEAP_ARGUMENT. The code currently assumes that this attribute only contains "-Xmx" and will add its own value either way. If an admin specifies the attribute with an actual memory value, we will end up with syntactically wrong concatenations (i.e. "-Xmx1024m1024m").
check_ins: 2010-Oct-25 17:08   Check-in [19211]: Setting JAVA_MAXHEAP_ARGUMENT was broken and would lead to concatenated memory values, since a default value is set in all cases. This fixes this behavior (described in ticket #1734 ). (By Cathrin Weiss )
